title: Read our publications open access
body: DAI has contributed to archaeological literature since its foundation in the early 19th century. From our regular journals featuring our latest research projects, to digitized versions of series and comprehensive monographs on specific fields of research - we publish and share knowledge that scholars can build on and freely use for their own research. Our publications are accessible via iDAI.publications/journals and iDAI.publications/books. Both systems are networked with other digital resources and complemented by the publication of databases. The publications of the DAI undergo a peer review process and are editorially supervised.

text: Over 240 journal volumes, 2,500 articles, 3,000 digital facsimiles and books

content.headline: Journals
content.text: Via iDAI.publications/journals the DAI provides numerous articles of its journals open accessible

content.headline: Books
content.text: Via iDAI.publications/books the DAI provides numerous of its series and monographs open accessible

tiles.headline: Forum for Digital Archaeology and Infrastructure

link.text: Forum for Digital Archaeology and Infrastructure

title: Data enhanced print publications with partners

tiles.headline: Catalog of Antiquity Spoils in Glienicke Palace
tiles.text: Objects from the collection of Prince Carl of Prussia, edited by Sepp-Gustav Gröschel.

tiles.headline: MKT 20: Anatomical Votives in the Sanctuaries of Latium
tiles.text: Catalogue of 116 find spots in iDAI.objects

tiles.headline: DAA 21: The Roman Imperial Villa Pausilypon
tiles.text: Catalogue of digital images in iDAI.objects showing ground plans and sections of the complexes of the Villa Pausilypon.

tiles.headline: AF 42: Heydays and Crises in Roman Imperial Etruria
tiles.text: Collection of GIS resources accessible via iDAI.geoserver

tiles.headline: AF 44: Cultural Contacts in the north-eastern Azov region
tiles.text: Supplementary online catalogues of finds from Novo Zolotovka and Dugino in iDAI.objects

tiles.headline: Boğazköy-Ḫattuša 28: Excavations in the Lower City I
tiles.text: Supplementary research data and archival material accessible via IANUS

tiles.headline: Taymāʾ II: New Inscriptions discovered in Tayma
tiles.text: Collection of artifacts documented with Reflectance Transformation Imaging (RTI)

tiles.headline: AF 43: Studies on the Urban History of Meninx (Djerba)
tiles.text: Digital documentation of an excavation published with iDAI.field-web.

tiles.headline: AvP 17: The grotto sanctuary on the 'Osthang'
tiles.text: Extended online catalogue in iDAI.objects belonging to the publication AvP 17

tiles.headline: AF 39: Mummy masks of the Roman Empire
tiles.text: Database-Catalog in iDAI.objects belonging to the publication AF 39

tiles.headline: PF 19: Architecture under the Attalids
tiles.text: Catalog of digital objects belonging to the publication PF 19: Architektur unter den Attaliden. Pergamon und die Städte zwischen herrscherlichem Bauengagement und Lokaltradition by Eric Laufer

tiles.headline: FAAK 18: The vault in Mayan architecture
tiles.text: Complete catalog of digital objects belonging to the publication FAAk 19: La bóveda en la arquitectura maya by Laura Gilabert Sansalvador

tiles.headline: MB 37: Ayamonte. Digital documentation
tiles.text: Digital documentation of an excavation published with iDAI.field Web. It belongs to the publication Madrider Beiträge 37: Die phönizische Nekropole von Ayamonte: Die Ausgrabung im Jahre 2013 und ihre Vor- und Begleituntersuchungen by Dirce Marzoli and Elisabet García Teyssandier (Eds.)

tiles.headline: Boha 29: Small finds from the upper city of Hattusa
tiles.text: Catalog belonging to the publication Boha 29: Kleinfunde aus der Oberstadt von Hattusa: Das zentrale Tempelviertel und die Tempelviertel am Königs- und Löwentor by Suzanne Herbordt and Alwo von Wickede

tiles.headline: Milet V 4: Finds from Miletus
tiles.subhead: Laconian and Chian Fine Ware Pottery
tiles.text: Catalog belonging to the publication Milet V 4: Funde aus Milet. Teil 4, Laconian and Chian Fine Ware Pottery at Miletus by Gerald P. Schaus

tiles.headline: MAR 41: Reproduction and image
tiles.text: Catalog belonging to the publication MAR 41: Reproduction and image. Repetition and reproduction of Roman reliefs by Arne Reinhardt

tiles.headline: Resafa 9,1: The city walls of Resafa (Syria)
tiles.text: Supplemental data to the publication about the city walls of Resafa

tiles.headline: FAAK 16: Paracas Archaeological Materials
tiles.text: The catalog provides data and images of archaeological finds and contexts which have been excavated since 1996 by the Nasca-Palpa Project.

tiles.headline: Palilia 32: 'Large statuettes' in Medma (Calabria)
tiles.text: Online catalog to the publication by D. Döpner

tiles.headline: Siracusa - La città e le sue mura
tiles.text: Studies on the Sicilian city of Syracuse

tiles.headline: Inden
tiles.text: A digital documentation of an excavation of the 1960s

tiles.headline: Antike Plastik 5.0.://
tiles.text: Media of documentation in archaeology

tiles.headline: Images and Imaginations of Roman Harbors

link.text: External Link to 'Images and Imaginations of Roman Harbors'

tiles.text: A publication regarding the documentation and contextualized analysis of depictions of Roman harbors using Arachne.

tiles.headline: The Basilica Aemilia on the Forum Romanum

link.text: External Link to 'The Basilica Aemilia on the Forum Romanum'

tiles.text: A publication on the Basilica Aemilia on the Forum Romanum as a focus of public life. A study of its remains, functions, and roles in Rome.

tiles.headline: Corpus of Minoan and Mycenaean Seals

link.text: External Link to 'Corpus of Minoan and Mycenaean Seals'

tiles.text: The project’s aim is the scholarly publication of every preserved seal and clay cast from the Aegean Bronze Age. Most of the Corpus should be digitized, updated and available on the Internet for free before the project ends in 2011.

tiles.headline: Domestic Culture in Late Antique Ostia

link.text: Domestic Culture in Late Antique Ostia

tiles.text: A publication on the well-preserved remains of residential houses in the port city of Ostia that allow insights into the relationship of continuity and transformation between Imperial times and Late Antiquity.

tiles.headline: Sanctuaries in Kanatha
tiles.text: A publication on the Syrian city of Kanatha and its specific forms of sanctuaries in Hellenistic and Roman times and the coexistence of indigenous religions and the Roman state religion.

tiles.headline: Figurative Reception of Greek Poets and Philosophers

link.text: Figurative Reception of Greek Poets and Philosophers

tiles.text: A publication on a project that is researching the depictions of the discourse of Greek education by using different classes of material such as gems, cameos, lamps, reliefs.

tiles.headline: PF 17: Terracottas from Pergamon
tiles.text: Catalog belonging to the publication PF 17:  Terrakotten aus Pergamon. Tonfiguren und -objekte aus der Wohnstadt am Südhang der Akropolis und von weiteren Fundorten by Sven Kielau

tiles.headline: Roman Terracotta Masks
tiles.text: The project “Terracotta Masks” is based on a dissertation about Roman Terracotta masks in the northwestern provinces conducted at the University of Cologne.

tiles.headline: Sea Creatures on Roman Sarcophagi
tiles.text: Publication on a work on the depiction of sea creatures on Roman sarcophagi with an online catalog showing new relevant pieces. The aim of the publication is to objectively re-evaluate previous assumptions.

tiles.headline: Dressed to Drill. Roman Centurions' Equipment

link.text: Dressed to Drill. Roman Centurions' Equipment

tiles.text: The publication compiles tombstones erected for centurions also depicting military equipment.

tiles.headline: Berlin Universities, Staatliche Museen
tiles.text: As part of the cooperative project Das Berliner Skulpturennetzwerk, every plaster cast in Berlin (from Freie Universität, Humboldt-Universität, and the Antikensammlung/State Museums of Berlin) representing an ancient object was systematically recorded and entered into ARACHNE.

tiles.headline: Akademisches Kunstmuseum Bonn
tiles.text: Image database of the Plaster Cast Collection of Ancient Sculpture of the Academic Art Museum of the University of Bonn.

tiles.headline: Staatliche Museen Berlin
tiles.text: A complete catalog of sculptures in the Antikensammlung der Staatlichen Museen zu Berlin. It contains approximately 2,600 Greek, Cypriot, Etruscan, and Roman sculptures in stone, as well as several large bronzes.

tiles.headline: Fasanerie Castle Fulda
tiles.text: Catalog of the Ancient Sculptures in the Fasanerie Castle (Adolphseck) near Fulda.Among furniture, porcelain and paintings, Fasanerie Castle (Adolphseck) in Eichenzell near Fulda also features a collection of Greco-Roman sculpture, which was assembled by Landgrave Philipp of Hesse (1896-1980).

tiles.headline: Leipzig University
tiles.text: Image database of the Museum of Antiquities and the plaster cast collection of the Leipzig University.

tiles.headline: Villa Wolkonsky Rome
tiles.text: A data enhanced publication of the holdings of the Villa Wolkonsky in Rome.

tiles.headline: Saarbrücken University
tiles.text: The plaster cast collection of the University of Saarbrücken makes its cast accessible online through the image database Arachne.

tiles.headline: Suermondt-Ludwig-Museum Aachen
tiles.text: The antiquities collection of the Suermondt-Ludwig-Museum in Aachen.

tiles.headline: Winckelmann Museum Stendal
tiles.text: Due to the special character of the Stendal Museum, dedicated to the founder of archaeology, the collection holdings appear very heterogeneous and can well be subsumed under the heading “Reception of Antique and Winckelmann”. These objects are integrated into the Arachne database.

tiles.headline: Archaeological Museum Thessaloniki
tiles.text: The Archaeological Museum of Thessaloniki uses the Arachne object database for documenting its sculpture digitally.
